Greetings to President of Cameroon
articles.content:
Greetings to President of Cameroon 
    Pyongyang, May 19 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, President of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, sent a message of greetings to Paul Biya, President of the Republic of Cameroon, on May 13 on the occasion of the 31st anniversary of the republic.
 Expressing belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would grow stronger, the message wished the president and the people of Cameroon greater success in their work for national unity and the prosperity of the country.

Talks between FMs of DPRK and Switzerland
articles.content:
Talks between FMs of DPRK and Switzerland
    Pyongyang, May 19 (KCNA) -- Talks between Paek Nam Sun, DPRK Minister of Foreign Affairs, and Micheline Calmy-rey, chief of the Federal Department of Foreign Affairs of the Swiss Confederation, took place at the Mansudae Assembly Hall today.
 At the talks both sides exchanged views on boosting the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries and a series of issues of mutual concern.    
 Present at the talks from the DPRK side were officials concerned and from the Swiss side the foreign minister and her party and the resident coordinator of the Swiss Agency for Development and Cooperation of the Federal Department of Foreign Affairs in the DPRK.

articles.title: Kim Yong Nam meets Swiss FM
MOU signed between DPRK and Switzerland
articles.content:
MOU signed between DPRK and Switzerland
    Pyongyang, May 19 (KCNA) -- A memorandum of understanding on the implementation of super-tension power grid project was signed here on Monday between the Power Industry General Bureau under the Ministry of Power and Coal Industries of the DPRK and the Swiss ABB Ltd. Company.
 Present at the signing ceremony from the DPRK side were Han Pong Chun, Minister of Power and Coal Industries, and other officials concerned and from the Swiss side chief of the Federal Department of Foreign Affairs of the Swiss Confederation Micheline Calmy-rey and her party, representative of the ABB Ltd. Company here Felix Abt and Swedish Ambassador to the DPRK Paul Beijer.

Canadian government decides to donate food to DPRK
articles.content:
Canadian government decides to donate food to DPRK
    Pyongyang, May 19 (KCNA) -- The government of Canada recently decided to donate food worth 2.5 million dollars to the DPRK through the WFP.

articles.title: South delegation here
articles.content:
South delegation here
    Pyongyang, May 19 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the south side led by Kim Kwang Rim, chairman of the south side to the north-south committee for the promotion of economic cooperation who is also vice-minister of finance and economy of South Korea, arrived here today to participate in the 5th meeting of the committee.
 It was greeted at the airport by members of the north side to the committee.
